categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
Patient's Alternative Name Rule
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="48765-2" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Allergies, adverse reactions, alerts"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Allergies Concern observation effective times reflect the appropriate allergy concern status
categoryRubrics.description: An Allergy Concern of completed or suspended should have an allergy observation effectiveTime/high value present.Similarly an allergy Concern which is Active shall not have an Allergy observation effectiveTime/high value.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

issuesList.xmlString: ampicillin
penicillin G

categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

<value xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="236578006" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED CT" displayName="Chronic rejection of kidney transplant" xsi:type="CD">
                    <translation code="996.81" codeSystem="ICD9" codeSystemName="ICD9" displayName="Chronic rejection of kidney transplant"/>

                  </value>

<value xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="234347009" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED CT" displayName="Anemia in chronic kidney disease" xsi:type="CD">
                    <translation code="285.21" codeSystem="ICD9" codeSystemName="ICD9" displayName="Anemia in chronic kidney disease"/>
                    <translation code="N18.9" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.90" codeSystemName="ICD10" displayName="Anemia in chronic kidney disease"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: All problem codes are should express with core subset of SNOMED codes
Problem Concern effective times reflect the appropriate problem concern status
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveDate/Times for historical events should be greater than the patient's date of birth and less than the earliest of current time or patient's date of death.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="59408-5" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Oxygen saturation by Pulse oximetry"/>
<code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="39156-5" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="BMI (Body Mass Index)"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: The Vital Sign Observation entries should use LOINC codes to represent the type of vital sign being captured

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="3150-0" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Inhaled oxygen concentration"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the vital sign observation present in the document should use the recommended LOINC codes to represent the vital sign.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each of the Vital Sign Observations should use the recommended UCUM units to represent the vital sign measurement result
categoryRubrics.description: The recommended UCUM units should be used to represent the Vital Sign result values as part of the observation

categoryRubrics.rule: The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Vital Sign Organizer must encompass the underlying observations
categoryRubrics.description: The EffectiveDate/Time elements of the Vital Signs Organizer cannot be out of sync with the Vital Signs Observation. Each of the Observation's EffectiveTime/low >= Organizer's EffectiveTime/low and Observation's EffectiveTime/high should be <= Organizer's EffectiveTime/high

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value

referenceErrors.description: A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Problem Observation (V3) 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.4:2015-08-01. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).

The node '@unit' does not exist at the expected path /ClinicalDocument[1]/component[1]/structuredBody[1]/component[16]/section[1]/entry[7]/organizer[1]/component[1]/observation[1]/value[1] but is required as per the specification: If Observation/value is a physical quantity (xsi:type="PQ"), the unit of measure SHALL be selected from ValueSet UnitsOfMeasureCaseSensitive 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12839 DYNAMIC (CONF:1198-31484).
referenceErrors.type: ONC 2015 S&CC Vocabulary Validation Conformance Error
